messages: e2936270accba24476ba5f7ecaf40557 (02:02): ok where would i put the font in suse
e2936270accba24476ba5f7ecaf40557 (02:05): does anyone play mohaa on suse?
e657c5b4a6ed51b6fbec293d00905f48 (02:06): yeah I tried
5b61d2cc0223d1497173cb5ab988ef5b (02:06): _ryno, run online update and select "Download Microsoft(r) TrueType Core Fonts".  This will install Verdana along with MS's other core web fonts.
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:08): Is there a separate channel for SLED or is this where one should come?
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:09): I have tried looking for #SLED but there was nobody else there.
5b61d2cc0223d1497173cb5ab988ef5b (02:09): !ask @hagus
2df02513b1d88e78542a6a8a65beb11a (02:09): hagus: Do not ask to ask, just ask, preferably politely. Those asking to ask risk axing. Oh, and do not ask meta-questions.
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:09): rofl at the metaquestions :)

d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:11): About a month or so ago, I tried suse linux 10.1 and liked it, sjones, but I discovered SLED on a magazine coverdisk, so thought I would give it a try.  However it is gnome based by default versus SUSE's kde :)
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:13): My all-in-one HP 1400 is not supported as a scanner by the HP linux drivers but I can always revert to winxp for that ;)
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:14): hi dare derRichard @_
b9ff38622b888abf934e0ea662ec229b (02:15): night all
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:15): hagus I print from my linux system to my printer on my Winbox... you could do the same if desired :)

d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:17): I have two usb printers attached to my machine - (which is partitioned with winxp/linux) - one is just a printer and works fine.  Although the other is a printer, on windows, I use it mainly as a scanner.
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:17): MIght I be able to use wine to get it to do anything or is that not really a promising direction to go for printers?
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:18): I imagine that wine is more application oriented rather than device oriented.
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:19): I think thats a fair assumption hagus
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:19): When run xsane etc, my scanner is not recognised even though it is recognised as a printer :)
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:19): It is just a cheap all-in-one which I once got in an emergency.
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:19): hagus:  did you check the HP web site??
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:20): It seems that the driver that comes with suse for hplip or whatever it's called is about the only one.

5b61d2cc0223d1497173cb5ab988ef5b (02:23): gniretar_work, assuming this is the correct one, perl-Net-Server-0.90-10 is what I have on my box (SL10.1).
1d2215129595fdc4eb46aa09495ac7e6 (02:23): thanks sjones
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:27): Have you tried this SLED thingy, kkathman?
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:27): nope  Im suse linux 10.1 :)
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:28): This is pretty much the same but has a more stable feel to it :)
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:28): Apparently it gets released every couple of years.
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:28): well i cant really complaint too much about stability
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:29): ive been able to do pretty much what I want, and the patches/updates keep me using the best applications

d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:29): What the differences are I am not sure except that suse is kde by default and this is gnome by default - and I was pleasantly surprised by gnome this time - it did not feel quite so old-fashioned to me as before.
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:29): well thats good, if you like that :)
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:29): I only got it last night :)
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:29): Im pretty much a kde person myself :)
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:30): but thats a good thing...choice is always a good thing

d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:31): I liked kde on SUSE and I surprised myself by liking gnome this time, I was all set to install all kde stuff instead but I liked what I saw ok and I was afraid that the extra files would just slow things down for me ;)
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:32): So, meantime anyway, I thought I would just stick with gnome.
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:32): the newer gnome installs are very performant.  They are very adequate for most everyone.
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:33): I tried the very newest recently on ubuntu...and it was very peppy
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:33): I tried kubuntu 6. something but I have not tried the ubuntu of the same version.
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:34): kubuntu is basically just the ubuntu base with a KDE gui
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:34): ubuntu, on the other hand, uses gnome as its default
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:35): but you can install the other from either version
886d20cff3a367239edf2ee6de8593c7 (02:35): why did they do that and not just have a choice at the beggining of install ?
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:35): Whenever I have encountered gnome in the past, I have tended to steer clear of it - not because it lets me down but because I used to think of it as dull :)
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:36): well you can dress gnome up about as much as KDE, though its not as easy
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:36): I do not know why novell makes suse kde and sled gnome.
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:36): of course, in just about any distro you can use apps from one in the other
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:37): I have the feeling that gnome has been tried and tested more?
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:37): eh I dunno either
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:37): well it could be that theere is less for their support team to worry about w/gnome??  I dunno.
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:37): Actually with SUSE Linux you get the choice of which gui you want during install
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:38): but it would be nice if SUSE would get to a single CD install, and do they rest by net
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:39): I think that still has issues with many
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:39): Yes - but newbies like me are a wee bit scared to try to install non-default choices unless we really need them :)
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:39): However, it is nice to have the choice
d922a22018d0a9684d9bc01814572a82 (02:40): Sled is aimed at office / home office environments as far as I can understand things.
c322cf561b23d7bdb9b192a922e5679a (02:41): well I think SLED could be targeted that way, yes.

2df02513b1d88e78542a6a8a65beb11a (02:52): peter77: To upgrade to a newer Suse from an older version with little or no problems, use a CD/DVD set and choose "Update" at the menu, for detailed instructions go here: http://spinink.net/2006/05/13/3-ways-of-upgrading-to-suse-linux-101/
